reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very welcoming and cosy hotel. Refurbished rooms are very good. Open fire and pretty courtyard create a very relaxing "house party feel". Service was charming but occasionally a little slow. Very good location within 2 minutes of the metro (St Sulpice) and a few minutes walk from the Luxembourg Gardens, Pantheon, St Germaine des Pres and Place St Sulpice. No restaurant but an abundance of good brasseries and cafes nearby.
reviews.title: Really cosy little place

likes.liked: — The open fireplace, the beautiful courtyard and the great location
likes.disliked: — Bar service was very slow but very friendly and apologetic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the reviews oin Tripadvisor we chose this hotel for our 4-day stay in Paris.We arrived before the room was ready (checkin is 12.00 which anyway is quite early) but while waitng was served a coffee and croissant in the lobby. 12.15 we checked. Our room was somewhat small but in excellent shape. The hotel is just 50 m off the noisy streets but as soon as you enter it is quiet. We could sleep with our window open with no noise problem. How ofte do you find a quiet room in a major city.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast room (Orangeri) with the beautiful garden is very nice.
reviews.title: Gem of an hotel

reviews.text: Due to an early flight we had to check-out before breakfast opened but the waiter arranged for us to have our breakfast 20 min before opening time. That warms.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain

likes.liked: — Quality of hotel, beautiful environment, excellent staff
likes.disliked: — The bed was a little firmer than I normally like, but the pillows were great.

reviews.title: loved the atmosphere and breakfast room
reviews.text: The hotel is located within walking distance to most of the "must-sees". Near Quartier Latin with its busy night life.

reviews.title: Excellent stay, but expensive
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay here for four nights in Feb. Room was great. It wasn't large but had a good sized bath. Particularly enjoyed having breakfast in the conservatory. Location is excellent. At €250/night it is quite expensive - but probably fairly priced for Paris.

reviews.title: oasis of calm
reviews.text: On arrival i was a little concerned our room,located at the top of the hotel,would be less than private because a team of decorators were operating just outside in the hallway. In the event they were quiet with no real problems.

We loved the peace and efficiency of the hotel and the staff, who,without exception were friendly and courteous, the breakfasts were delicious served in the attractive atrium made this a lovely experience ,a particular feature was the REAL fire in the lounge,-for me a wonderful bonus.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very happy stay,and i would have no hesitation in recomending the hotel to one and all.
reviews.title: Very nice, wonderful experience
l'Abbaye is spectacular
reviews.text: Staying at Hotel de l'Abbaye was a pleasant experience. The staff were

This is a lovely hotel. It's clean, and the service is excellent. Also, the staff were friendly and helpful. They recommend great restaurants, and are great about calling taxis for you, or making reservations, or getting other info.
reviews.title: charming, helpful

likes.disliked: — the auto light switch in the internet booth

reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk from Parc Luxebourg - which is gorgeous. It's in St Germaine, which is a great shopping district (take a map! the streets are pretty confusing).
reviews.title: What a wonderful place to stay !

likes.liked: — Bedroom, bathroom, ambience, furnishings, staff and location.

reviews.text: The included breakfast consists of jam and croissants/other pastries, plus coffee or juice. They charge extra for menu items. Anyway, we were quite happy with the croissants.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Hotel L'Abbaye St. Germain

reviews.text: The breakfast room and lobby are super comfortable. The former overlooks a quaint courtyard and the latter is amply supplied with every variety of magazine and newspaper.
reviews.title: Great Charm and Gentility

likes.disliked: — room was on the small side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself is Paris-sized for sure, but we certainly didn't feel cramped. It's comfortable and clean, with a nice big bathtub.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel de l'Abbaye for 6 days over the New Year holiday. There were large floral arrangements of white amarylis and white hyacinths all throughout the lobby which was one of the little touches that were so wonderful in this hotel. The breakfast area looked out onto a well designed garden area displayed with red cyclamen, white daffodils, and more hyacinths. This hotel makes you feel special and relaxed because of these eye-pleasing touches. The staff was always polite, welcoming and very efficient and helpful with our varied questions.
reviews.title: A wonderful boutique hotel
Weekend in Paris
reviews.text: Our room was one of the apartment rooms and we had quite a large bathroom with a shower and a bath. The housekeeping service was very good, and we were happy with our room which had an upstairs bedroom and downstairs living area. We hope to return again in the future.

reviews.title: Enjoyed L'Abbaye once again
reviews.text: This is a very charming, quiet hotel close to a Metro stop, shopping and good restaurants. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful (very proficient with English). A typical French continental breakfast was included. Although we had a standard room that is quite small by any measure, it was attractively decorated (this being Paris) with an efficient layout. We thought the hotel offered a very good value for the money and would definitely stay there again.

The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The downstairs area is especially charming - set out like an elegant French home with fresh flowers, a fireplace(great for chilly winter days) and comfortable lounges. The back garden with fountain is beautiful. The staff are helpful and willingly speak English. Its located close to many of Paris's main attractions notably the Louvre, Decorative arts Museum (both 20 mins walk away), Musee de Cluny (10-15mins), Notre Dame, good restaurants (do try Le Petit Cours) and leading fashion stores. My only quibble is that I find the beds very hard. Also as I have partner the twin beds pushed together rather than a queen sized bed makes sleeping together a bit uncomfortable. Don't know of this is the same in all rooms.
reviews.title: A wonderful little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a wonderful little hotel, beautifully located with exceptional service. Especially wonderful were the continental breakfasts, which are served anytime after 7 in a beautiful room with a coutyard/garden view. The hotel is exceptionally clean and very nicely appointed. The staff were attentive and helpful. The only negative is that we were given an icredibly tiny double room upon arrival, so small that there was not even room for the suitcases, and with not a single drawer of storage space. But the hotel staff happily moved us to a larger (but not especially spacious) room after we complained. The baths are nice but small, often with a tub but without shower. So if you don't mind a cozy room, this is a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: Paris December 2007

likes.liked: — Size of the room for a large city -

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.
reviews.text: Good attentive service from staff, couple of light bulbs out in the room

reviews.title: Very close to perfect
reviews.text: I will tell you what I was looking for and I think you will see that the Hotel de L'Abbaye Saint-Germain came very close to being perfect. My husband prefers a 5 star hotel that has American type amenities like a stall shower and big screen TVs. My daughter and I don't care about the stars, we want something with personality, charm and lots of nearby strolling opportunities.

reviews.title: Will go back to l'Abbaye St-Germain
reviews.text: We booked two rooms - one standard, which had two twin beds and a bath with handheld shower. Very charming, very comfortable - a little roomier than the European standard. The other room was a suite and it was just huge! It was actually a duplex with one floor having a small parlor with TV, couch, easy chair, desk and a full bath with tub and shower stall. The upstairs had a very roomy bedroom, queen size bed, half bathroom (just a toilet /sink) and a terrace that looked over the courtyard with two chairs and a table. Charming!!!! And the bathroom turned out to be my husband's favorite ever - heated floor in the shower, real water pressure, gorgeous marble. Not to mention that all TVs were large, flat panel.

reviews.title: The Jewel of the Left Bank
reviews.text: I heartily agree with previous posts that mention how very special the service is, on this level they can compete with any 5 star. And the public spaces for breakfast / evening cocktail / relaxation are great too.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: One very small criticism - the beds were just average in terms of comfort. The mattresses were quite firm and the sheets had that starched feeling, something I thought had gone out of style a long time ago. We had stayed at a Sofitel in Dijon the night before and while that is a very businessy hotel, the beds were incredible. Since Sofitel sells these mattresses through a brochure, I would suggest that the L'Abbaye grab a few of them ASAP.
Charming Boutique Hotel in the heart of the Left Bank. Excellent shopping and Cafes in the immediate area. Within easy walking distance of the major Paris sites.
reviews.title: Absolutely Charming Hotel

likes.liked: — The Charming Decor and especially the courtyard area
likes.disliked: — No refrigerators in the rooms. Main kitchen did allow guests to store items though.

reviews.text: We stay at the l'Abbaye with our 3 children and the hotel took excellent care of all our needs. They have a beautiful courtyard where we ate our breakfast and enjoyed evening cocktails.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.text: Room Tip: The Suite on the first floor of the hotel includes a sunroom overlooking the courtyard area. Very charming and completely updated!
reviews.title: An Oasis In the City

reviews.text: We'll definitely return to this hotel!
reviews.title: What a great place!

likes.liked: — The feeling - we just elt at home!
likes.disliked: — No TV in the upstairs studio - not a big issue tjough

reviews.text: Stayed for a long weekend having picked the hotel due to the high rating on Tripadvisor and we were definitely not disappointed. It is true that the location is not super prime but being only a 5 minute walk from Boulevard St Germain one could hardly say it is in the sticks.
reviews.title: Wish I could have loved it more
Great hotel. Staff was the best. Dining was very good.
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at Hotel de l'Abbaye Saint-Germain. Rooms were beautiful, neighborhood was great. Hotel staff was great. We couldn't have been more pleased.

reviews.title: Quiet unspoilt paris!
reviews.text: Quiet oasis in a throbbing city,. Beautiful public rooms with lovely internal garden,very helpful staff.

reviews.title: Perfect location, perfect service, perfect hotel
reviews.text: Standard rooms tiny but well maintained.Bathroom supplies limited to shampoo, moistener and soap only.

reviews.title: Peaceful & perfect location
reviews.text: Would recommend and go back, though expensive.

reviews.title: Just Delightful
reviews.text: I stayed here for a business trip March 22-28, the room booked by my employer’s travel unit. The hotel’s 4 stars are fairly earned. While there are only about 40 or so rooms, there seems to be a higher ratio of employees to rooms than some other similarly sized hotels. The concierges, bar staff, and other employees were world-class: always professional, pleasant, helpful, and informative. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and well maintained, but the service is even better. I stayed in room #2, on the ground floor, which looks in the small, perfect garden. This room had a small dining nook set out into the garden and a door leading to a patio that would be perfect for breakfast in warmer weather. The hotel was completely insulated from any street noise. I’ve been to Paris dozens of times, but have always stayed in different hotels—this hotel might be my favorite and I will certainly return to it.

reviews.title: Perfect in Paris
reviews.text: My husband and I were in Paris for a long awaited trip in September 2008 and stayed at Hotel de L'Abbaye in Saint Germain. It was the perfect place for us. The location was great with many choices of small french restaurants nearby, as well as shopping and metro. Many of the places we wanted to visit were within a 15 - 20 minute walk. The hotel was beautiful, peaceful, the staff outstanding. It was a treat to go to the lovely dining area overlooking a courtyard every morning for a continental breakfast included in the cost. We would definately stay here again.
...it was very pricey for what it was.
reviews.title: I concur with the good reviews but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start with the good points!
reviews.title: Location was great

reviews.text: Firstly, the location was fabulous in the heart of the Latin Quarter and it is a few moments walk from Boulevard Saint Germain.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel

likes.liked: — The overall atmosphere of the Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly, the building is beautiful and welcoming and we felt like we were returning to our own cosy pad at the end of a day's sightseeing. Great log fire and a plethora of reading material to cosy up to on plush sofas.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great position, rooms, garden, staff

likes.liked: — Breakfast and eating area, courtyard, rooms, position
